page.title: 05Dunston
page.content: The village of Dunston covers 650 acres and has a population of 52. The majority of these are elderly with only 7 children. It is extremely hard to find work in the village so they have to gop elsewhere to find a job. One farme only employs 3 in the summer and 0 in the winter; this is due to modern machinery. For many years there have been few changes to the houses, extensions only being allowed. Electricity and water were brought to the village in 1960. The most notable feaatures of the hamlet are the Hall, but principally the Common of about 7 acres, used for dog walking, picnics and quiet enjoyment. The common belongs to the Sout Norfolk District Council, although the villagers maintain their grazing rights.
